Title: What Is Blue Carbon?
Description: The IAEA works with scientists all over the world to study Blue Carbon, the organic carbon that is captured and stored by the ocean in vegetated coastal ecosystems such as mangrove forests, saltmarshes or seagrass meadows.

Title: From Preparedness to Resilience: The Role of the IAEA in Nuclear ...
Description: Ahead of the International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction on 13 October, we look at the role played by the IAEA’s unique Incident and Emergency Centre in preparing and responding to potential nuclear or radiological emergencies.

Title: Update 254 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) has restored its connection to a 150 kilovolt (kV) power line that could be used as a back-up option for the plant, although the supplies of electricity needed for reactor cooling and other essential functions remain fragile, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said today.

Title: IAEA Concludes Long Term Operation Safety Review at Sweden’s Oska...
Description: An International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) team of experts today completed a review of long term operational safety of the Oskarshamn Nuclear Power Plant (NPP) Unit 3 in Sweden.

Title: IAEA Director General in Slovenia Before Key Nuclear Power Refere...
Description: The IAEA Director General has engaged with Slovenian leaders and civil society today, in the lead up to a key referendum on expanding the country’s nuclear power programme.

Title: Independent Review Assesses IAEA’s Internal Safety Regulatory Sys...
Description: The first-ever independent review of the International Atomic Energy Agency's (IAEA) internal radiation safety regulatory framework has confirmed that the system is well-established, with the IAEA's regulator showing a strong dedication to ongoing enhancement and improvement.

Title: IAEA Experts Find Evidence of Microplastic Pollution in Antarctic...
Description: A pioneering IAEA mission to Antarctica has found evidence of microplastic pollution in lakes, shorelines and the ocean.

Title: World Cotton Day: The Role of Nuclear Science
Description: To mark World Cotton Day, the IAEA Director General has highlighted how nuclear science helps optimize the growth of the world’s most important natural fibre, at celebrations in Benin this morning. .

Title: Update 253 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has been informed both by the Russian Federation and Ukraine about the assassination last week of an individual in the city where most staff of the Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) live, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi said today.

Title: Photo Highlights from the IAEA’s 68th General Conference
Description: The 68th IAEA General Conference photo highlights are now available.

Title: IAEA to Conduct Second Extensive Sampling of Marine Environment N...
Description: A team of scientists from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) will return to Japan next week to conduct marine sampling near the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Station (FDNPS).

Title: Update 252 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) lost the connection to its only remaining back-up power line for 36 hours this week, underlining the fragility of the electricity supplies it needs to cool its six reactors and for other essential nuclear safety and security functions, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said today.

Title: IAEA Helps Burundi Ensure Food Security with Healthy Cattle
Description: By introducing superior breeds of livestock and harnessing cutting-edge techniques to tackle animal diseases, the IAEA is helping Burundi to ensure food security.

Title: Celebrating 60 Years of the Unique FAO and IAEA Partnership
Description: This October, the Joint FAO/IAEA Centre of Nuclear Techniques in Food and Agriculture is celebrating a remarkable milestone — its 60th anniversary.

Title: Woman of Steel: The Earthquake Engineer Building a More Resilient...
Description: Zeynep Gulerce’s career has been shaped by earthquakes. She was a young civil-engineer-in-training in Türkiye when a magnitude 7.4 earthquake struck the Kocaeli Province of the country.

Title: Optimized Radiotherapy Approach Could Extend Treatment to 2.2 Mil...
Description: Implementing hypofractionation – fewer but higher doses of radiation per daily treatment session over a shorter time frame – compared with conventional radiotherapy in prostate and breast cancer could provide radiotherapy for an additional 2.2 million patients globally, according to a Lancet Oncology Commission led by the IAEA.
